website_summaries.verdict: A good middle-of-the-road modem that works with most Internet providers.
pros: Compatible with Comcast Xfinity, Spectrum, Time Warner, Cox, and more
Provides Internet speeds of up to 686 Mbps for download and 131 Mbps upload
Ideal for gaming and streaming HD video
cons: Does not include a Wi-Fi router and is not compatible with Verizon, AT&T, or CenturyLink
The indicator LEDs are also very bright and can be distracting

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Amazon warehouse deals
customer_reviews.text: Be careful buying an amazon warehouse deal. Comcast came out to install and said the modem was registered to someone else. They couldn’t reach them so had them so now I have to use a rental modem until they can verify and change modem registration. Then once that clears I need to swap the rental and drive It back to a Comcast store. Guessing my bill will probably take a while to sort out too. Painful.
customer_reviews.author: Max Janasik

customer_reviews.title: USE THIS ITEM WITH CAUTION!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this modem, because my Internet provider gave me a free upgrade. It worked great until, after a few weeks usage. It started to give off a bad plastic burning smell, and was very hot to touch. A few days later, I returned the modem to Amazon for an exchange of a new one. I haven't connected the new one yet. As I decided to go back using the modem I had for 2 years. If you buy this, please please use with caution. If you smell anything that is burning within the area of this modem, quickly disconnect it, and return. You're putting your home at risk of a fire, if you do not.
customer_reviews.author: DayDreamerGurl

customer_reviews.title: Dumps signal several times a day
customer_reviews.text: Modem is fast when it works, supporting my 225Mbs download speeds from Comcast, but it goes off line several times a day. The lights on the modem show it's working, but it isn't providing a signal to my router or my computer, which is hard-wired to the modem. Comcast has been out here and looked extensively at the problem, confirming that their end is not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: kagy

customer_reviews.title: Failed After 5 months. Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Modem failed after about 5 months use. Would not reboot. When unhooked to power and power up again all 4 lights would come on so boot up sequence failed and modem unable to establish internet connection. Put old modem back on and installed with Comcast. Arris customer assistance by e mail was useless. Product under warranty, but Arris does not honor warranty.
customer_reviews.author: RDM

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs. Emits a horrible smell and is a potential fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: I would avoid this modem at all costs. I have now gone through two of them, from amazon. Both began emitting a strange smell after about two weeks of use. It is a wierd smell that smells liike burning and body odor, and it makes me REALLY nervous. At best, it will make your room really stinky (it is very evident from and fills my entire living room) and at worst is a potential fire hazard. I thought I was crazy but after looking through other reviews, this same smell seems to have happened to other people as well.
customer_reviews.author: JBones

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying (service provider) equipment rental fees
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! - works with comcast so save the highest rental fee in the country of $10 per month for the comcast modem - ridiculous Comcast says it should be able to provision the unit in a few minutes - mine took 2.5 hours............ not the product - it was comcast other than the comcast 4 port modem / router you will need to ensure you connect you incoming cable to this modem then ethernet form this modem to your router from your router to your devices or expansion switch ( I know this is elementary, my house was originally setup comcast modem /router 1 port to expansion switch and 2 port to router) s
customer_reviews.author: Busted Knuckle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: My modem stopped working within 2 years and I called tech support. After a long amount of time waiting and answering questions about my modem I was told they couldn't do anything. All they had me "troubleshoot" was turn off and on again, didn't work? Oh well, gotta buy a new one. They won't fix/replace even though is within the warranty timeframe because in the same day there was rain in my area. No power outage, no blips, nothing, just a storm in my area. My recommendation for anyone buying this product is to lie to them because if yoi are honest they will stick it to you. Will not be purchasing Arris again!
customer_reviews.author: gdrinot

customer_reviews.title: Modem sold by BlueDealz was USED in OPENED box with UNSEALED packaging
customer_reviews.text: ***BLUEDEALZ WARNING*** The ARRIS SURFboard SB6183 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem sold to me by BlueDealz on Amazon in July 2020 was NOT NEW and was a USED item in an OPENED box with UNSEALED packaging. In the event this modem was used for illicit activity by the prior owner I want nothing to do with it. Immediately returned as I needed a new modem right away. EXTREMELY DISPLEASED!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Roboto

customer_reviews.title: It pays to take a chance
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Comcast subscriber and have been for about a year. I had been renting my router/modem combo all that time ($10 a month). While it was pretty good service, out didn't even approach the 400 Mbps speed that was advertised. I had enough! I'd read plenty about the Arris Surfboard and, after doing my research, decided to get one. Holy cow... What a difference! I just got it and already I can see how much faster this is! From the elimination of buffering while streaming, to my lightning fast downloads, to the instant opening of web pages... I'm so happy I took the chance and bought the Arris Surfboard... Comcast can keep their equipment!
customer_reviews.author: Looney2ne

customer_reviews.title: Died 5 months and 2 days after its warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: This modem has a 2 year (24 month) warranty, which was a factor in choosing to buy it 29 months ago. It was easy to hook up, came with a nice beefy external power supply that didn't seem like it would fail young, and worked without a hitch with our Comcast Xfinity service. Electronics die eventually, and I don't expect a lot from consumer electronics. Even with surge suppressors and line protection, I'm used to replacing a cable modem every 5–8 years. But this one failed unusually young, so I give it a low "durability" score despite it otherwise performing as advertised. It just stings when something dies so soon after its warranty period...
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Modem works fine
customer_reviews.text: I thought that switching from DSL to Comcast cable would be simple. Ultimately it all works now, but I did need to call Arris for technical support. The person who helped me was very good and helped me to get things working. I was very impressed with the help I got. The modem works great so far. Things are easy if you know exactly what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Comcast Modem if you have your own WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I already have a top end wifi router and didn't want to pay Comcast $15 a month to rent theirs. I have 200 Mega bit service from XFinity and this modem can deliver the full 200 Megabits when doing tests. It's only good to 300 Megabits so if you have faster service this is not the modem for you. So in short it works perfectly (had it for 2 months with zero issues) for those needing a cheap cable modem and having their own Wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Sowden

customer_reviews.title: Setup within ten minutes.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up. I did have to call my ISP (Spectrum) to have them recognize it so it took me a whole ten minutes to get this modem up and running between unboxing and having internet. Instructions are simple, and the modem is simple so it's very easy. The router (purchased separately) took a little bit longer. If you're shying away from having a separate modem and router, do not fear. It really is a simple process and you'll have faster internet and better Wi-Fi!
customer_reviews.author: JRB

customer_reviews.title: Works with Cablevision !
customer_reviews.text: This modem model is not listed on Cablevision site as one of their compatible units. Before ordering called tech and was told they test listed modems so could not be sure about this model (?). Simple hook up of power cord, cable line and router connection. Call to Cablevision Tech Support and after giving MAC # had internet access in 5 minutes. Just connected today so can't comment on longevity etc. With a 7 month pay off (cable company just began $10. monthly rental ) this seems like way to go.
customer_reviews.author: anonymousl

customer_reviews.title: Quick and works with Optimum [CT]
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this modem to replace my rented Optimum modem. Wow, nearly double the speed! Had some difficulty installing this thing since there was no instructions with the modem (knocked a star off for that). It doesn't even mention how to access the modem setup menu. Did a quick google search and found that in order for this to work with optimum in Connecticut, you have to register the modem at install.optimum.com. Once i registered it, the modem worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Reviewer #12

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a little power house!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with Xfinity/Comcast because I did not want their modem. Setup was super simple, just follow the instructions if you do not know what you're doing. I use this with my 150mbps plan and it almost always exceeds those speeds! Very happy with its performance. I have had it for about 7 months now and it has not once dropped connection or had to be reset! Depending on where you put it and how much it bothers you, the blue LED lights are rather bright, so heads up. I have also not had any issues with this getting too hot or warm.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Purice

customer_reviews.title: When it works - great. Do not expect any tech support when it does not.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem for less than 1.5 years. It was determined faulty by Comcast Business. I replaced it with a new Motorola modem and my random drops went away. Good luck speaking to speak to Arris Support. These people are not focused on any customer satisfaction. Extremely rude. Even after showing them the evidence the modem is faulty, they want it activated back on Comcast's network (which we confirmed it was faulty). I went with a Motorola modem for now - I will not be purchasing Arris any time ever again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paluszek

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the big black modem to Comcast rents.
customer_reviews.text: So far I haven't zero outages with this router Comcast modem I would have power rangers multiple times a week. So far so good. I bought the used version first until I found out that the MAC address was in use by another customer so I had to return and buy this new version instead, for almost double the price. Not what I wanted to spend but working out well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Too Hot to Handle
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine, but ran very HOT! The metal coax connector was too hot to touch. This seemed unusually hot and unsafe. I placed an electrical fan underneath it and it fixed the heat issue, so I was going to keep it even though the heat issue concerned me. But after doing a little more research I came across the Motorola MB 7420. I decided to return the Arris and go with the Motorola. It is in the same price range, more updated specs and it runs much cooler (w/o a fan on it 24/7). Also it looks to be better build all the way around. Compare for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: allysant

customer_reviews.title: Works From Start
customer_reviews.text: This model is the one Cox uses for it's rental subscribers. Arris is the modem Cox finds most reliable of the brand choices it gives to consumers that are approved for purchase. Lucky I chose it from Amazon customer input! I'd give it five starts for wifi strength but not sure if the slower speed than offered is an issue with Cox system or Arris. I know my router, an Orbi, is not responsible for loss of speed as it worked better than advertised, at my previous house with FIOS. Haven't used Tech Support so no idea how good they are. The product set up is simple and hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: COMCAST COMPATIBLE YES! no matter what rep says
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my comcast representative said this was not compatible with them even though the description said it was...COMCAST WAS WRONG It did not connect immediately so I had to call to give MAC address. She was wrong she put in Arris SB6183 and it returned not compatible BUT Motorola SB6183 IS compatible so I returned it and all that hassle for nothing. Arris IS Motorola I guess and they were dumb about getting the software check updated to include the name Arris as well...What do you expect with cable? This is compatible and would have been perfect unit for me.
customer_reviews.author: D William

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic seller
customer_reviews.text: This is more about the seller than the product. I bought a used modem from eternitywireless. The first didn't work. I contacted them... Super responsive and helpful. They sent a replacement out immediately. That one also didn't work. Again... Very helpful and responsive. Sent the third out as well as a return shipping label. The third one worked though I think it was new and not used. I am appreciative for the cooperation and helpfulness they showed. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Wish had gone with rental modem :(
customer_reviews.text: Comcast/Xfinity will not send someone over to check why I keep getting disconnected. They say "signal is strong and clean and you own the modem. contact manufacturer.". ARRIS support is none exiting. Went to site. Open ticket. Added logs from modem. No response in over a month. Stuck on a service that I can't use, with a device that has no other purpose to connect to Internet with cable. Have friend that works with Comcast. Not even him can make them check line or modem. BTW, the modem is lock by Comcast after activating. They manages all aspects of it. Including firmware. They have access to the logs which state that the modem is having trouble negotiating the communication.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar A. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tech support from real people
customer_reviews.text: I was on the phone with comcast all day and they said the problem was the modem so I called Arris and the tech support person was super helpful and friendly and he figured out that the problem was with the netgear router and he helped me set that up even though that is a different brand! Outstanding customer service and our wifi is blazing fast. Also in case you are thinking of renting from comcast. DON'T DO IT. Save yourself the money and the trouble of having a subpar modem from comcast and buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Marty McFly

customer_reviews.title: Works well with optimum (cablevision) internet service
customer_reviews.text: This modem is fully compatible with optimum internet service. Since optimum charges $10/month to rent their modem, using your own modem is cheaper in a long run. Replacing modem is very easy and can be done without calling cable company. Also this modem seems to be more stable and has better performance than optimum provided model.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ericson

customer_reviews.title: good price, compatible with optimum
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, good wifi?? i think wifi is about the router not the modern. Tech support? i haven't called them yet, and i am hoping i will never need to call them. The price is really nice and it is compatible with optimum, which save me $10/month. the reason i only gave four stars is that: for the first hour i can't use my wifi at all, i kept restarting the router and modern. it never happened before. I am not sure whose fault it was: optimum router or this modern. I think it is worth buying since it is not expensive and saves me money every month.
customer_reviews.author: ling

customer_reviews.title: Stop renting your Modem, and buy this!
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of subscription with Optimum, we realized that we were charged monthly for our Modem (10 USD), so we figured we did not want to pay 120 dollars a year for a product that we can own. A bit of research online and we arrived to this modem. It just easy to install and you need to call Optimum support and give them a code to finish the installation. It seems a lot of work at the beginning, but trust me, its not. The best thing is the internet now is faster and more reliable than before (Optimum modem was crap) and you own your modem and router. Best decision ever.
customer_reviews.author: henry urrunaga diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great modem!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this modem for 7 months with Comcast Xfinity, and it's worked flawlessly from the day I installed it. This is my second Arris modem, and the older one (SB6141) that I bought in early 2013 also has and continues to work with Comcast Xfinity flawlessly. I definitely recommend this Arris modem. btw, both of my items are only modems, not modem + router. (Note that I have not rated the Tech Support simply because I've never had to use it.)
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy Crochet Lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, simple, fast replacement for Optimum rental modem
customer_reviews.text: Simple replacement of the old modem I was renting from Optimum. Just use the Optimum self-installation guide to install this modem and save yourself the monthly modem rental fee. You only need to enter your account number, last name, and phone number for the self-installation. If I had known how simple the installation was, I would have swapped out and returned my rental modem sooner. Also, my internet speed is faster with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: im_beach_comber

customer_reviews.title: SB6183 does not work with the mesh eero wifi router
customer_reviews.text: After hours of time troubleshooting with different customer service reps (eero, roku, youtube tv, arris, and ISP) for more than 1 week, I ordered a new arris modem (SB8200). Youtube TV worked with my old Apple airport express router and the Arris SB6183. However, I could not get eero, roku, youtube tv to work with the Arris SB6183. YouTube TV works perfectly with eero and Arris SB8200. I do not recommend this SB6183 if you have an eero mesh wifi router. I hope this review saves someone time. I can't get that time back!
customer_reviews.author: sc

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: upgraded my cable speed and when I called the cable company (COX) they said I needed a cable modem upgrade. Asked them for a recommendation and of course they backpedaled from doing so. I carefully worded my question and asked "which cable model do you have the least customer complaints and problems with for 300 MBPS installations" - the guy paused and said this one. Sure enough I ordered it and it installed in less than 10 min on the phone with my service provider and it has worked flawlessly since I turned it on. I cant say enough good things - highly recommended and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Island

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk - if  you have ANY problems before the return window, RETURN IT
customer_reviews.text: My internet hasn't worked properly since I got this modem, but it took six weeks of working with Comcast (and having them replace every fitting, cable, etc.) until I realized the problem is the modem, and now it's too late to return it. My internet goes in and out all day long. I NEVER should have bought this from an Amazon seller.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri H.

customer_reviews.title: Solid. reliable product
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an older model. First, I checked which models would work with my Internet provider, then I scoped out the possibilities, then I ordered this model. It was an easy, straightforward install, has been very reliable since I bought it. The features I would like would be some way to remind one to reboot it periodically (to refresh it), automatic firmware updates (which it may have), and an intuitive way to check it online.
customer_reviews.author: brifd1

customer_reviews.title: Drops b/c gets too hot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a spare in Dec 2017, just plugged it in for the first time 1 month ago (so, out of the warranty period). Long story short, it runs hot and if the room temp is also hot (85-90F) it drops the connection. Have to let it cool for 10 minutes (or just spray it cold) and it's good until it gets too hot again, which doesn't take long. Which makes me want to avoid buying another Arris to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Speaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Standalone Modem!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, I am so happy to have a simple, regular, modem-only modem again. I have never had good luck with an all-in-one unit. One of the weirder problems I was having with Spectrums routers, was certain things just taking a long time to connect. Messages in Messenger would take a long time to send, etc. Since switching out the Spectrum modem and activating this one, I have had no problems at all. It was (the modem) a little smaller than I had envisioned, but it works great. I just had to call Spectrum and give them the HFC MAC address and that was it. Very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Faster than my old modem
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems to be working as advertised. I got a note from Comcast that my modem was slower than the internet I was signed up for, so I tried this one because it was one of the cheapest that met the requirements not only of my current plan, but also of the potential future upgrade they are going to be giving me (my area?) in the near future. I have noticed my internet is a little quicker now which is good, but I'm not the techie-est guy around.
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: works as it should with Grande
customer_reviews.text: works as it should with Grande internet service. I thought i was going to have an issue because after the installer left i had no internet and the send and receive lights were flashing. I called Grande and found out the installer got the MAC address wrong by 1 digit, as soon as this was fixed the modem came to life and I had internet. for some reason this review had me rate the wireless performance..... this modem doesn't have wireless so i marked it as 5 star but to be clear this is a modem only and doesn't have wifi built in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonoholic

customer_reviews.title: Works for Optimum by Altis
customer_reviews.text: After I cancelled my cable and VOIP services from Optimum, they started charging me $10 a month for the cable modem "rental" on top of my Internet service charge. Using Optimum's self service portal, it takes only about 10 minutes to swap the modem. I will return the 5 years old Optimum this week and will be recouped the cost of this modem within 7 months. I can't really comment on the speed since I did not have chance to perform speed tests during the swap. The boot up time for this unit seems to be much faster than the Optimum's unit.
customer_reviews.author: KYM

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Comcast once activated. The activation took time due to Comcast installation application issues. Once it's registered with Comcast, it's a good idea to restart the modem with your devices such as laptops or wi-fi routers as some devices may require the modem to push gateway info to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not work well with a mesh wireless router
customer_reviews.text: This modem will not work well with a mesh wireless router, Purchased and installed in March to work with a EERO wireless router system. Ever since the modem was installed we began to experience increasing issues with downloads. At the suggestion of EERO customer support (and seeing similar complaints in online forums) we changed to a different modem. All the download problems went away. We called Arris requesting to return the product for a refund and were told it was too late and they would not accept a return. Unfortunate customer service for a product that does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: This is my backup one
customer_reviews.text: I have had another one of this exact model for almost four years now. I was told it wouldn't last that long. Have this for back up, just in case. I use along with a router and it works for several devices and two people. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kaya

customer_reviews.title: Setup was very easy with comcast / xfinity -1 star because it runs ...
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than comcast default router. Paying for 75mb/s and recieving 120mb/s with this in Nashville, TN. Setup was very easy with comcast / xfinity -1 star because it runs very very hot (the plastic might burn you) This means some percentage of the plastic is likely liquifying or out-gasing and the shiny white color and country of origin leads me to believe there are minor lead out gasings from this device. Although I do not have the precise expert knowledge nor instruments to measure this effect. Recommend running this modem near a fan Also -1 star because standard users cannot update firmware on their own
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Way Better than ISP-supplied modem
customer_reviews.text: Because our ISP-rental modem clearly wasn’t the best item on the market, we opted to buy the Arris 6183. What a great choice. No issues with installing or set up. Plug and play. This, with a newly purchased WiFi router, fixed the crummy speed and dropped service. Should have done this months ago and saved money from the rental fee. Call your ISP-mine was 0ptimum-and give them those numbers on the bottom sticker and off to the races!
customer_reviews.author: NJ Guy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Save your $10 modem fee from your internet company such as Optimum, Spectrum or Comcast and get this modem. I've only had it for a few days and maybe my review changes but for now it's super fast and I feel like I'm getting the full potential of my 200 download speed. Please note this a standalone modem that doesn't have a built-in router. I personally combining this with a Google router which are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Persian Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cox in Omaha
customer_reviews.text: Decent modem for Cox Ultimate, 300 max mbps down. Recently switched my plan to triple speed, thus my old ARRIS wouldn't quite cut it anymore maxing out at about 150 down. Now I'm getting 250+ with around 40-50 upload--right in range with where it should be. Knowing the reliability of other ARRIS modems throughout the years, this Surfboard should be no different in lasting for quite some time. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Deal
customer_reviews.text: The ARRIS I purchased was exactly what I needed for full house coverage of the wifi signal coming out. It was also the best deal for purchasing the item. If a buyer has more than 1200 sq ft of living space, then the 3 packs is the best deal on the market.
customer_reviews.author: SouthernVproducts

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With X-Finity
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research trying to find a modem that was inexpensive and would work with X-Finity. I've had this installed for the past year and so far there have been no problems. It was easy to set up. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PJH

customer_reviews.title: Fast, stable
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, had comcast set it up. Paying for 100mbps, delivering 119mbps rock solid. We live outside the city and 200 is about as fast as we can get, no need for docis3.1 for these speeds, so 3.0 works perfect. Lights are bright, would not want it on my tv stand. Thats about the only negative if you can even call bright lights a negative.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Non wifi model works great
customer_reviews.text: I got the model that was just a modem, have purchase 5 of these things in the past 10 or 12 years, have had nothing but good experiences with them, they just work and work with a wide variety of services.
customer_reviews.author: brendan

customer_reviews.title: Four years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem in May 2015. Used it with two providers, first with Spectrum and now with Suddenlink. Setup was easy both times. Never required tech support. We have a 400 mb/sec plan that rarely exceeds 100 mb/sec, which is an issue with Suddenlink, not this modem. At times, ISP provides service over 400 mb/sec, and this modem handles it easily. Never had a problem in over four years. Until Suddenlink upgrades to DOCSIS 3.1, we intend to keep this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Edit: second one failed too... Second time owner, first one failed in less than a year...
customer_reviews.text: Edit: second modem failed today, 8/4/2019 when the ethernet port stopped working. Will be buying a different brand in the future. These are garbage. Hope the second one lasts longer than the first. The first one randomly died on me, not allowing any connection. Also got extremely hot to the touch and put off a funny smell. Might be a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 15 months and now need a replacement (but not an ARRIS product)
customer_reviews.text: Now losing its mind about every four days, it started going belly-up about a month ago and family is now freaking out weekly over loss of internet (aaah!). It was purchased 15 months ago (purchased date January 2016). Having consistent problems with it and spend each week resetting the modem through our internet provider, unplugging it, letting it cool down and totally restarting the in-home IT set up, nothing is preventing another meltdown. This product is a thorn in my side and looking to replace it immediately with another brand (but which?). Our previous ARRIS lasted 25 months, of course just past the warranty period, this one barely half that.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Went from a rented ARRIS at 8 x 4 to this at 16 X 4. I did not run speed test; however, i do notice that my internet response is quicker than it was prior to installation. Installation and activation took less then 5 minutes using my phone to activate through xfinity activation site (directions provided in box). I also save $14 a month in rental fees. This Modem will pay for itself in 5 months
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little efficient modem.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing modem. The harsh blue lights can be turned off in software and made a nice peaceful green. Allows quite fast connections (I'm at 75 Mb/s, but this is undoubtedly not capped by the modem, but by my provider). It's very small, and consumes much less power than the equipment that most other people provide with their internet. I know some people say to get 3.1 instead of 3.0, but I don't think I could be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Maarten Hofman

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem running for 5 years now. If you're in a place for even just one year it makes no sense to rent a modem from your internet provider. Get yourself a modem, get yourself a SIGNIFICANTLY better WiFi router, and save some money. I recommend the predator nighthawk 1750 router for most families of 4-5 since tablets, smart TVs, smart home appliances and phones tend to dominate the state of our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Quality modem for Savers and Cord-cutters.
customer_reviews.text: Meets my cable company's requirements, enabling us to "cut the cord" and own our own modem. We dropped the land line phone service, so didn't need the telephony ports anymore, so this one was on their list of approved compatible modems and so far works great. If you're a cord cutter or simply want to save the monthly modem rental fee they charge and don't have a land line bundle, this one is quailty if on your ISP's approved list.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easty to Install and Setup - Working Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: Have had it a couple of months now and it's working great with Optimum. I have 200Mbps service and I get the full bandwidth and have not had a problem yet. Think it's safe for me to return the rented cable modem and maybe upgrade to 400Mbps. I know some people have mentioned this device can get hot. Haven't noticed that yet. I gets warm but I wouldn't say hot. Just be sure to keep it away from other things that can block the vents. I have nothing around it and it runs just warm.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: WIFI CALLING IS THE ISSUE
customer_reviews.text: This modem works fine for TV and WIFI BUT I continued to have trouble with WIFI calling. I was on the phone with xfinity service for hours; my wifi calling would work then if I took my phone with me when I left my home when I returned it wouldn't work. I could go to the xfinity store and my Iphone 7+ phone's WIFI calling would work. I finally gave up and rented the cable modem from xfinity for $11 per month. I don't know if the problem was this modem or xfinity but I NEED WIFI calling at home so I have it now with xfinity's modem.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with CentraCom
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality. The box comes with an ethernet wire and power wire. Bought this to use with CentraCom but CentraCom just came out with an approved router list and this is not on the list. We called CentraCom just to make sure and they confirmed that it doesn't work with CentraCom.
customer_reviews.author: Value Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very bright LED. Maybe not an issue if you get black.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a SB6121 for years now in black and it was solid, never any issues. I got the SB6183 so I can upgrade my internet speeds. Looks and feels just like the SB6121 but in white. The problem with the white one is that the blue LEDs show... A lot. The thing just glows blue all the time. Not really a big deal but if you have it in a dark room, it may be an issue. Been up and running without any issues. Cox wanted to rent me a modem for $10/month. Got this one for $60 and it should last me another few years.
customer_reviews.author: Alex.CA

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to contribute my review because I went through a few pages of reviews and didn't see any mentioning whether it works with RCN (Lehigh Valley). I set it up with a call to RCN in 5 minutes, you just tell them you want to return their modem and need help reprovisioning your own modem. It's been working flawlessly but it's only been a week so I'll update if any changes happen. The lights are bright as some people have said. I turned it sideways and hid it behind a case because it's annoying but not a deal breaker. It runs hot but so did the RCN modem I'm looking forward to saving $10 a month
customer_reviews.author: Carla H

customer_reviews.title: Was surprisingly easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Received it much quicker than expected, thanks Amazon. Was surprisingly easy to set up. For once Comcast was quick and helpful in getting it registered with them. I carefully tested download speeds with the old modem, and then tested again with the SB6183 from various servers all across the country. I was very happy to see much improved download speeds every time. The ping from my favorite Battlefield server went down from average of 62 to around 45 now. Had it up and running for nearly a month now with no problems. Very happy with this modem and would highly recommend to others. The only very minor con; as others have reported.....lights on modem are much too bright.
customer_reviews.author: sykes

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot and eventually burnt out
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years, the product overheated and burnt out. I kept it well ventilated but didn't help. The device needs a fan in order to last longer or some other cooling feature.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Small and works well but LEDs are too bright.
customer_reviews.text: It's works fairly well with TWC's 300Mbps internet service. I get about 320Mbps average DL and 20Mbps UL. The DL speeds vary quite a bit from 250Mbps to 350Mbps but I'm not sure if it's on TWC's end or the modem. The device itself is fairly small but the blue DS/US LEDs are way too bright due to perforations in the case allowing the light to leak out from both sides. I also didn't like the fact it doesn't have an on/off switch like my Zoom modem.
customer_reviews.author: RYZEN

customer_reviews.title: Better performance for less cost
customer_reviews.text: Mediacom is allowing 60 megabits per second at its base rate if the cable modem is DOCSIS 3.0, which this 16 channels down 3 channels up modem is. Purchase payback (over rental) is 1/2 year not counting savings from a rate drop yielding better performance. It's durable - problems have all turned out to be on the ISP's end - and ready for more speed if I care to pay for it. Until gigabit becomes common this modem will last.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for mediacom
customer_reviews.text: Updated 8/11/19 almost 3 years old and still going strong. I've never had an issue getting awesome speeds or working with Mediacom. I'll buy a new 3.1docsis when I go to gigabit speed. Until then I'll keep using this one. Doubled my speed. I went to mediacom ultra 100mb and was only getting upwards of 50 on my trusty 6120. Now I'm actually over 100. Hitting 115 probably due to multiple channels. Mediacom has 8 download right now and I'm guessing I'm using all of them. Yay. Easy setup, called mediacom and they had me plug in everything except the router of course and within minutes I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. Support useless.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. Couldn’t connect to my old router so I bought a new one (thanks arris) and that didn’t work. I called my ISP, my router company, then finally arris. Their support was literally did you try turning off and on again. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Internet connection speed, very attractive looking device.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an older cable modem (Motorola SB6121) to ensure I would get the best connection possible now and for future service upgrades from my cable company (Time Warner). Very easy to setup and took about 10 minutes for Time Warner to activate it over the phone. Download and upload specs are the same as compared to the SB6121 using speedtest.net, however, websites seem to load faster. I also seem get better connection speeds on my PS4 for on-line gaming or video and music streaming. I also like how this cable modem is designed. It is a very attractive looking device, especially, in a dark room. It looks beautiful with a blue, violet glow. (see my photos)
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: These fail around the 2 year mark
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 10 of these between Jan 2017 and Sep 2017 to replace modems from Comcast to avoid the rentals. It's now Feb 2019, and all the ones purchased in Jan 2017 have now failed or require daily reboots to function. Arris support will not help me and suggest I read up on their website and fix the problem myself. Never buying another Arris product for home or for business.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: slower than the modem I was replacing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because Comcast had upgraded the speed on my internet and my old modem wasn't fast enough any longer. This was very easy to install, but it was slower than the old one. Two people couldn't be on the internet on their phones at the same time. Often I couldn't be on when nobody else was around. Comcast test speeds were slower than what the old speed was. Sent this back and replaced it with another brand with the same stats and it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B

customer_reviews.title: Superfast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is Fast.... lightning fast. Prior to upgrading to this modem I was getting roughly 50-57 Mbps ( 6.25 MB average) which is pretty good in itself. Being that I work from home sending oracle/sql/exchange databases and other test files to and from our corporate office I heard my internet has been upgraded and I needed a faster modem to obtain said speeds. I decided on this one, since I have had Arris modems for years. I now download at 300-323 Mbps (40 MB average) you won't actually download that fast from most websites but just to know you can do that is more than satisfactory. Just take a look at the screen shot.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice But...
customer_reviews.text: This is a small unit at 5.5 inches tall. It works great. The only thing I wish I knew before I bought it was that it lights up a blue color and stays on all the time. It gets warm too and puts out the heat. I think it will be nice in the winter months, but not in the summer. There are vent holes on 3 sides so I would imagine you cannot lay it down due to the heat and need to vent it. Overall, it's a nice unit so far and works nice. I just wish it didn't have the blue light.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: My cable provider has had a lot of problems providing reliable service. I really appreciate being able to log on to this modem and monitor the "events" in real time. I can then use this information to get faster service and I don't have to run through the standard "is your internet working" checklist (which starts with "Is your modem on"). I'm suppose to have 300M service. When my cable provider hasn't downgraded that service without discussing it with me, I get great download times.
customer_reviews.author: John Zwiebel

customer_reviews.title: Died in under 3 months.  Runs fast.  Buy a model faster with more channels than your service max speed.
customer_reviews.text: Died in under 3 months. I only use in a single family home. Should not die this quickly. I replaced it with the model above this and running well so far. I read in another review that if you buy a modem with more channels and more speed than what your service is rated at, the modem will get you more than the max speed you are paying for. This is true. I only have a 100Mb connection. And this modem is rated for alot higher speed and i consistently speedtest at about 105-115.
customer_reviews.author: dko3tgk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem for two reasons. First Comcast has it on my list and it's 4 years newer than my previous SB120. Second, I was hoping it would fix my intermittent and slow internet from Comcast. Well, nothing can make up for Comcast's short comings, but at least my internet connections are not longer dropped, which means that although download speeds are still slow (not due to modem), less time is wasted by Windows struggling with losing and regaining it's internet connection. Good product, worth buying. It provides 16 simultaneous downstream paths vs. my previous 4, although it runs a little warmer than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: selective buyer

customer_reviews.title: Died after 15 months.  Cheap crap.....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed this modem in February of 2018. It died this past Sunday 5/12/19. This short life is not acceptable and was quite unexpected. Fortunately I had kept my old modem and got back up fairly quick. I expect a modem to NEVER fail quite honestly. Very discouraging....
customer_reviews.author: Turmatic

customer_reviews.title: Both my upload and download speeds increased significantly
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the modem and router provided by my internet server with this ARRIS Surfboard and a NetGear router. I have repeatedly tested the modem download and upload speeds with a direct cable to my computer and both have improved a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: MPC

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months, waiting on replacement which I paid shipping
customer_reviews.text: Died after 4 months. The item was under warranty so I'm now waiting for a replacement. Be warned: if your unit dies YOU PAY to ship the modem to them for the replacement. Modem worked fine for those 4 months. My previous modem was a surfboard which lasted 8 years, really disappointed in the quality of this.
customer_reviews.author: Liz McEwan

customer_reviews.title: It fixed my problem
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model of SurfBoard Modem (? SB 6141) that I bought about 3 years ago for my cable internet (now it runs about 143 mbps). It took about a week to discover the intermittently poor connections were from the modem and not the provider. Since I have never had a modem go bad before I just gave a 3 star assessment of durability based on the old modem! This modem does use a little more juice (about 3 watts) than the old but my connections have been rock solid!
customer_reviews.author: K. Keppel

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward simple installation: 1. Connect coaxial cable ...
customer_reviews.text: Straight forward simple installation: 1. Connect coaxial cable to Modem. 2. Connect Cat5 ethernet cable from Modem to computer. 3. Connect power line to Modem. 4. Call your Internet Service Provider, e.g. Optimum, Tech Support to supply Modem's HFC MAC address. Tech Support will register the Modem and activate it. They will ask you to reboot Modem once or twice. Verify that Modem is online by using your computer to browse the internet. Disconnect computer from Modem and connect WiFi Router. Complete Router's set up instructions
customer_reviews.author: E. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Get the speed you are paying for
customer_reviews.text: Had to get replacement quickly when cox internet suddenly would not work with old modem. Arrived in one day w/prime. Easy to install. According to cox, now getting internet speed that I am paying for. Old modem did not support level if service i was paying for but until service suddenly stopped, was not aware that old modem was limiting me. Cox never notified me that old modem was not robust enough. I recommend periodically checking to see if your service is supported by your hardware. Don't count on ISP to notify you. Have been using unit for weeks now with no major issues. Happy that amazon could send so quickly at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonConsumer

customer_reviews.title: This modem will pay for itself if you are renting.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the Comcast modem I was renting with my new service because I was getting about 90mbps despite paying for 200mbps. Comcast tried to tell me that replacing the modem wouldn't solve my issue, however after installing this modem I get at least 200mbps with no broadcasting a hotspot (they like to default their modems to this), I can use ipv6, and overall with the firmware settings I feel more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Stools

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I learned earlier this year that Time Warner Cable was nearing completion of system and infrastructure upgrades that would increase customer broadband speeds in my service area by significant amounts (download boosted to 200+ Mbps from 30 Mbps, and upload to 20+ Mbps from 5 Mbps). At the same time, I also learned that my old Moto SurfBoard 6120 wasn't capable of processing such speeds, so I bought the SB6183. It works like a charm - see attached photo. Funny how TWC managed to find all this hidden speed right after Google announced that they were bringing Fiber to my area!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Reality

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working about two months after I bought it. I called their "customer service," who tried to convince me that the modem wasn't working properly because I wasn't using a coaxial cable from Comcast. What a joke,. Avoid at all costs, garbage company.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Not even able to reach 250mbps
customer_reviews.text: This modem should be able to do 680+mbps but couldn't even make it to 250mbps. Went back to my ISP provided modem and I get the full 600mbps my account offers. Hours on the phone with the ISP to make sure the new modem was provisioned, 3 techs came by to check the cabling from the poles down to the modem and no issues were found. It was definitely the modem. Been happy with Arris in the past but this was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jay V

customer_reviews.title: Great well supported modem
customer_reviews.text: I have TW cable and was tired of the monthly rental fees for my modem. I wanted a modem that is more future proof. This one is approved by all the major carriers, and has the latest standards capable of 686Mbps. Not that I have that fast of service now, but who knows what I will have/want in the future? It set up easily. I just hooked it up and called TW for activation. An added bonus is my download speeds tripled for free (the TW rep mentioned this, and it was true). Couldn't be happier. Highly recommended. Note: This modem does not have a router or wireless. Simply connect a wireless router to it for wireless capability.
customer_reviews.author: Scott (Technogeek)Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, saves me money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an Arris TM1602A 24x4 modem that Cablevision/Optimum started charging me $10/mo for when I dropped my cable package. Easy to set up: plugged it in, went to install.optimum.net, entered the requested information, reset the modem and I was good to go. Works just as well as my old modem, and it will pay for itself in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: The Latinist

customer_reviews.title: Sound, reasonably priced cable modem
customer_reviews.text: We access the internet via two different cable companies in two different states. We wanted a basic, reliable cable modem without its own wi-fi (in each case we have a home wi-fi network via a separate router). I settled on this ARRIS modem because on-line research indicated that it is not based on a particular chip which causes problems in some other cable modems. The two identical ARRIS units were very easy to set up and both are serving us well.
customer_reviews.author: Peripatetic

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Bright House Networks.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, called Bright House technical support and within 10 minutes they had it activated and up and running. Works much better than the older Motorola they offered. All I need is a cable modem to bridge me to my own router without any other fluff, and that's what this does. Also saves me a whole $4 on my cable bill every month, whatever will I do with this new wealth? Update: Has it been 3 years? Well, I'm no longer with Bright House as they got bought out by Spectrum. This modem still works flawlessly. Planning on updating to the newer version once Spectrum rolls out Gigabit speeds later this year.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HorryTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than renting
customer_reviews.text: Setting up this device was easy. I replaced an older Arris modem that was no longer supported by Comcast, and haven't missed a beat. Comcast charges a monthly fee for their modems and routers, but by owning my own, with warranty, I wold be able to replace these every year and still save money. Last one was three years before becoming non-supported. I expect as long or longer service from this one. Even if it's only a year, I'm ahead in terms of money spent. I'm a happy customer with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Overheats but works great if air cooled.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 1 month of use - update...................Have to return it for a replacement unit. This 1 overheats and shuts down! I live in Arizona and the temps get up there, well it hit 95+ yesterday and my 183 didnt care for it. It only worked when I put a 9" box fan in front of it running 24/7. Every time I turned the fan off - the modem turned off, turn the fan on and in 2 minutes the modem turned back on. I never had this problem with the old Arris 121 we had. That thing was tough as nails. So, I will see if the replacement has the same issues and will update this once again.
customer_reviews.author: Tooker

customer_reviews.title: I've had it 2 weeks with 0 problems
customer_reviews.text: My old cable modem was dropping my internet a few times a day. I've had this one for a couple weeks now, and I've had zero problems. It's been perfectly stable so far. It is only slightly warm, it doesn't overheat like some other arris modems have been known to. I will agree with the other review that says the lights are too bright. I wouldn't want this in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for the $$$$...
customer_reviews.text: Nice small unit with great capabilities. Switched from leased xfinity modem. Screwed in the cable, connected a computer, logged into xfinity and it programmed itself. Beware it DOES NOT have wifi - you will need a separate wifi router. Only has one networking plug in. Would buy again, but hoping I won't need to! Saving $10/month with this vs. the old crappy modem/router from xifinity.
customer_reviews.author: BBlewitt

customer_reviews.title: A Little Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 3 months now. I'm surprised how much this box gets very warm! I'm still out for debate on the speed its suppose to provide. I have a fast internet service and I upgraded to this Arris from a Motorola 2.0. At this point honestly I haven't seen a big pickup speed from this Arris. I have 3 wired connections to my router and about 6 wifi devices. (Not all at once, maybe 3 at a time) I figured from what it said I would get a little better surf speed. I am computer savvy and once in awhile I do have to reset the modem and wifi because they get to clouded.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Florez

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: My current Arris SURFboard was only two years old, but I had to replace it due to my internet speed being upgraded to 100 Mbps. I bought the SB6183 to handle the new download speed and am glad I did. It's compact and very easy to install. I hooked it up, contacted my ISP to register and activate it and it put me on the high-speed internet highway. My speed tests that I've done show consistent downloads in the range of 83 - 118 Mbps. Now we can watch Amazon Prime and Netflix videos with the annoying buffer overruns. I highly recommend this cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Douglas Powell

customer_reviews.title: Make sure Compatibility is correct Through specific Plan not Service.
customer_reviews.text: This router is supported by the services in the description. But only to a certain extent. The plan based on speeds needs certain requirements. So, before you buy make sure the modem is completely compatible from the listed subscriptions. Example: I have the service cox, this modem is cox certified but, not for the plan I have with cox. Please do a little more research before buying. You can google or look on the cox certified list for compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Off to a good start. The SB6183 does live upto its reputation.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem after the older SB6121 started showing signs of degradation (frequent disconnects, poor download speed). Received the SB6183, unboxed and made the connections as described. Hardwired a laptop to it and opened the browser. XFINITY (Comcast) prompt asked if I would like to register the new hardware. 20 seconds later, the modem was restarted and good to go. Download speeds were back to full speed. The whole process from unbox to browse was 2 minutes. I couldn't be more pleased. I will update this review after a month of usage.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Work well & good replacement for the Comcast modem
customer_reviews.text: Works well. We had a Comcast loaned modem for hmm 4 to 5 years? Kind of regret not buying our own starting from the getgo. But well, at least we did now. Goodbye monthly loan charges! This modem boosted our measured speed (not actual) by 10 mbps, but this could be because our old modem was, well, old. Nonetheless, it's been 20 days now, and everything's still going smoothly :D
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: too much problem
customer_reviews.text: When connected for the first time, all the lights stay solid and none of the lights blinked. Had nothing but problems. I tried many times. For some reason even when I would lose Internet connection Comcast shows the modem as being online. The factory reset and restart did not change anything.
customer_reviews.author: Hermanuella. R. Hyppolite

customer_reviews.title: More insane speed!
customer_reviews.text: I have been quite satisfied with previous SurfBoard models but needed to upgrade our SB6121 to take better advantage of our 200 mbps download speeds. It was simple PnP with the SB6183. Called Comcast to provision the new MAC address of the modem and was good to go in 5 minutes. Speed tests went from 130 mbps to 180. Of course, the old speed was still pretty fast. The only reason I upgraded our Internet package was for increased upload speed -- for that we didn't really need a new modem, but without a new modem we would be leaving performance on the table.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hoang

product_meta.title: ARRIS SURFboard SB6183 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem, Approved for Cox, Spectrum, Xfinity & others (White)
product_meta.description:
Size:Max Download Speed: 686 Mbps| Style:16x4 Cable Modem(White)| Pattern Name:CableBuilding upon the success of the SB6121 and SB6141, Arris / Motorola's SURFboard SB6183 enhances your personal media experience, at lightning-fast broadband speed. It harnesses the power of DOCSIS 3.0 technology to bond up to sixteen downstream channels and four upstream channels--providing you advanced multimedia services with data rates up to 686 Mbps download and 131 Mbps upload depending on your Cable Internet provider service.
